title: Sudan: Presidential Directives to Buy All Gold Produced By Traditional Miners
text:
Sudan: Remembering Jemera Rone 
The minister pointed out, during his address Monday to the first meeting of the committee formed by the ministry to control and purchase gold production from the traditional mining headed by the State at the Ministry of Minerals O'shaik Mohamed Tahir, that an agreement was reached between the Ministry of Minerals, the Central Bank of Sudan and the Finance Ministry to form a committee. Dr. Al-Karuri added that it was agreed to control the production of gold, imposition of censorship and trapping smuggling, especially in the border areas and control to ensure the supply of all the gold to the Central Bank of Sudan to buy it, as well as the development of mechanisms for coordination with the specifications and standards. 
It is to be recalled that the Minister of Minerals has issued a decision to form a committee to control and buy gold production from traditional mining. The jurisdictions of the committee was determined in development of policies and controls on purchasing of gold from the traditional mining as well as setting of a proposal to take advantage of the aggregate markets to open windows to buy gold at the traditional mining sites together with a conducting encouraging study to attract traditional miners to sell gold through the official channels, in addition to the development of policies to combat smuggling and its enforcement mechanisms.
